\begin{align} \int \left(1 - x\right)\sqrt{x}\,dx &= \int \left(\sqrt{x} - x \sqrt{x}\right)dx \\ &= \int x^{\dfrac{1}{2}}dx - \int x^{\dfrac{3}{2}}dx\\ &= \dfrac{x^{\dfrac{3}{2}}}{\left(\dfrac{3}{2}\right)} - \dfrac{x^{\dfrac{5}{2}}}{\left(\dfrac{5}{2}\right)} +C \\ &= \dfrac{2}{3}x^{\dfrac{3}{2}} - \dfrac{2}{5} x^{\dfrac{5}{2}} +C\\ \end{align}\\
\text{Here, C is the constant of integration}
